intro: Lastrea variabilis, commonly known as the variable lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, often blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. Due to its adaptability, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in arid and semi-arid regions.
